Package com.example.fairdraw.DBs

Class EventDB

java.lang.Object
com.example.fairdraw.DBs.EventDB
public class EventDB extends Object
Firestore helper for operations on the "events" collection.

Provides CRUD operations, list retrieval, and real-time listeners for events.

    Class

    static interface 
    EventDB.AddEventCallback
    Callback for when an Event is added to the database.

    Callback for when an Event is deleted from the database.
    static interface

    Callback for when an Event is retrieved from the database.
    static interface 
    EventDB.GetEventsCallback
    Callback for when a list of Events is retrieved from the database.
    static interface 
    EventDB.RemoveFromWaitlistCallback
    Callback for when a user is removed from the waitlist.
    static interface 
    EventDB.UpdateEventCallback
    Callback for when an Event is updated in the database.

  • Method Details

    • getEventCollection

      public static com.google.firebase.firestore.CollectionReference getEventCollection()
      Returns a CollectionReference pointing to the "events" collection.
      Returns:
      collection reference for events

    • getEvent

      public static void getEvent(String eventId, EventDB.GetEventCallback callback)
      Get a single event by id.
      Parameters:
      eventId - id of the event to retrieve
      callback - callback invoked with the Event or null

    • listenToEvent

      public static com.google.firebase.firestore.ListenerRegistration listenToEvent(String eventId, EventDB.GetEventCallback callback)
      Attach a real-time snapshot listener for a single event document.
      Parameters:
      eventId - id of the event to listen to
      callback - callback that receives Event updates
      Returns:
      ListenerRegistration handle which can be used to remove the listener

    • addEvent

      public static void addEvent(Event event, EventDB.AddEventCallback callback)
      Add a new event to the database.
      Parameters:
      event - event to add (event.getUuid() used as document id)
      callback - callback invoked with success flag when the operation completes

    • updateEvent

      public static void updateEvent(Event event, EventDB.UpdateEventCallback callback)
      Update an existing event document.
      Parameters:
      event - event with updated data
      callback - callback invoked with success flag when the operation completes

    • deleteEvent

      public static void deleteEvent(String eventId, EventDB.DeleteEventCallback callback)
      Delete an event by id.
      Parameters:
      eventId - id of the event to delete
      callback - callback invoked with success flag when the operation completes

    • getEvents

      public static void getEvents(EventDB.GetEventsCallback callback)
      Retrieve all events once.
      Parameters:
      callback - callback invoked with the list of events or null on error

    • listenToEvents

      public static com.google.firebase.firestore.ListenerRegistration listenToEvents(EventDB.GetEventsCallback callback)
      Attaches a snapshot listener to the events collection for real-time updates.
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback to be invoked on data changes.
      Returns:
      The listener registration.

    • removeFromWaitlist

      public static void removeFromWaitlist(String eventId, String deviceId, EventDB.RemoveFromWaitlistCallback callback)
      Removes a device from the waitlist of a specific event.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event to modify.
      deviceId - The ID of the device to remove from the waitlist.
      callback - The callback to be invoked upon completion.

    • addToWaitlist

      public static void addToWaitlist(String eventId, String deviceId, @Nullable Event.EntrantLocation location, EventDB.AddToWaitlistCallback callback)
      Adds a device to the waitlist of a specific event.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event to modify.
      deviceId - The ID of the device to add to the waitlist.
      callback - The callback to be invoked upon completion.
